License Name: License for Industrial Sector's use of petroleum product (feedstock)
License Description: This service enables the investor to engage in the activity of using the petroleum product (feedstock) in the industrial sector.
Conditions/Requirements:
* Having a valid commercial register.
* Presence of an operating license from the Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones, or the Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu, or the presence of each of (the municipality license, the civil defense license, and the environmental rehabilitation certificate).
* Presence of a registration license from the Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture, which includes quantities of petroleum products to be used and an industrial license for industrial agricultural projects.
* Presence of a contract from the entity that owns the project specifying the scope of work and the implementation period for the activities of the projects and construction activities.
* Presence of a contract from the entity that owns the project outlining the scope of work, implementation period, and responsibilities for project execution and construction activities.
*Having a license from the Water and Electricity Regulatory Entity.
*The company or entity carrying out a commercial activity shall bear responsibility for the damages and losses of petroleum products resulting from violating the laws and regulations related to the conduct of the commercial activity.
* The company or entity shall be registered on the Ministry's website.
* The company or entity shall be licensed by the Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources.
* The company or entity shall be licensed by the Ministry of Municipal, Rural Affairs and Housing for the activities of the project implementation and construction sector.
* The company or entity shall submit periodic reports to the Ministry and to keep documents related to commercial activity.
* The company or entity shall provide a list of the required petroleum products, their quantities and the purpose of their use.
* The company or entity shall provide a list of other materials involved in the manufacture of (feedstock), indicating the type, quantity and source.
* The company or entity shall submit an asphalt mix design approval certificate for the activities of the road construction sector.
* Registering commercial activity data at the Ministry of Energy, and updating it whenever needed, as determined by regulatory procedures.
* Submitting a copy of the ID of the facility owner, or a power of attorney, or an authorization certified by the Chamber of Commerce for the representative with a copy of his national ID.
* The company or entity shall provide a clear sketch of the site with coordinates and images.
* Presenting a master plan for the factory, for the activities of the industrial sector.
* Providing a detailed statement of the used generators, their efficiency, production capacity, and the monthly rate of fuel consumption.
* Providing a detailed list of petroleum products, quantities of consumption, and the number of equipment used for each month during the project period for the activities of the project implementation and construction.
Service Description: Registering on the Ministry of Energy's website, and applying for a license to use (feedstock).
Additional Information:
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.

License Name: Import Permit
License Description: This service enables the investor to purchase products from exporting countries and allow them to be imported to the local market.
Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
• The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• Product specifications should match the Saudi, GCC  or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• Applicant shall abide by the conditions and regulations attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of commercial register and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by respective entities and Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of Articles of association for a limited liability company.
• Presence of the articles of association for a  joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or agencies if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuing an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years/year.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

License Name: Import Permit
License Description: This service enables the investor to purchase products from exporting countries and allow them to be imported to the local market.
Conditions/Requirements:
•Applicant must be 18 years old or above.
•The employee must not be a governmental employee.
•The capital shall not be less than 5000 SAR.
•It is not required to issue a branch register for the same activity, practiced in the same administrative region.
Issuing the main register requires the following:
• Electronically submitting an application to establish the company.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Presence of a national ID.
Issuing a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
•Minimum capital of 500,000 SAR.
•Presence of the company's articles of association and articles of incorporation.
Issuing a branch register requires:
• Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, attested by the Chamber of Commerce.
• Confirmation of the investor's deposit at the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the investor's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

* Submitting periodic reports to the Ministry of Energy and keeping documents related to the commercial activity.

* The company or entity carrying out a commercial activity shall bear responsibility for the damages and losses of petroleum products resulting from violating the laws and regulations related to the practice of commercial activity.

•It is not required to issue a branch register for the same activity, practiced in the same administrative region.
Issuing the main register requires the following:
• Electronically submitting an application to establish the company.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Presence of a national ID.
Issuing a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
•Minimum capital of 500,000 SAR.
•Presence of the company's articles of association and articles of incorporation.
Issuing a branch register requires:
• Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, attested by the Chamber of Commerce.
• Confirmation of the investor's deposit at the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the investor's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
It is not required to issue a branch register in the event of a desire to practice the same activity, in the same administrative region, and under the same existing trade name.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
License Name: Permit to provide short message services (SMS)
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue or revoke a permit for short message services (text, audio, video), which are provided through licensed public telecommunications networks in the Kingdom, and are delivered directly to the beneficiary for the purpose of promoting a specific product, providing him with information, answering inquiries and other services. This includes broadcasting public messages to a specific region, and the permit allows purchasing the necessary infrastructure to provide and operate the service.
Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
• The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• Product specifications should match the Saudi, GCC  or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• Applicant shall abide by the conditions and regulations attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of commercial register and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by respective entities and Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of Articles of association for a limited liability company.
• Presence of the articles of association for a  joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or agencies if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuing an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years/year.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
License Name: License to Provide IoT-VNO Services
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue or cancel a permit for IoT virtual communication network operator services, which are provided for the purpose of enabling automated communication between machines and devices via data communication chips (SIM), embedded data communication chips (eSIM), or any equivalent future means.
Conditions/Requirements:
Presence of a valid commercial register, the validity period of which is not less than 3 months.
Presence of a valid general class license, the validity period of which is not less than 6 months.
Paying the fees for issuing the required permit.
Obtaning the approval of the relevant authorities in the event of cancellation of the permit.
Providing regulatory requirements for the service.
Submitting the application through the electronic licensing system.
Providing information about the entity and its representative as well as a profile of the applicant.
Providing data of any direct or indirect ownership relations between the applicant and any service provider in the Kingdom. In such a case, the Communications, Space and Technology Commission reviews these ownership relationships, and then decides to approve or reject the application according to the conditions determined and sole discretion.
Submitting all required documents and information in Arabic, and supporting documents (if any) can be submitted in English.
Submitting a signed copy of any agreement for operators of virtual communications networks for the Internet of Things, or a draft thereof, an award letter, or any other similar document concluded between the applicant and any service provider in the Kingdom, provided that it is in Arabic and may be accompanied by an English translation or the original English version.
Submitting a financial identification letter from a Saudi bank or an international bank approved by the Saudi Cenral Bank confirming that the applicant will be entitled to sufficient funding to implement the action plan submitted to the Communications, Space and Technology Commission.
Submittibg an action plan that includes the following:
  i. ‌ Corporate Strategy: presenting a high-level strategy with a statement of the method and extent of its contribution to advancing the development of the telecommunications market in the Kingdom.
  ii. Market study: Providing forecasts for the market and its divisions.
  iii. Customer care service plan, after-sales services, proposed service levels, and a continuous development plan to ensure quality services.
  iv. Services: they include the applicant’s services and products  planned to be provided, and sectors targeted, the timing of their provision, and the proposed approach to providing innovative services of virtual communication network operators for the Internet of Things.
  v. ‌Organizational Structure: It includes management, marketing, finance, information security, regulatory affairs and compliance, sales, customer care, operations, and technical support.
  vi. Human Resources Plan: Presentation of the detailed plan for human resources and the level of compliance with the Saudization rates established in accordance with the Kingdom’s laws, regulations, and legislation.
  vii. Financial Summary: Provides a financial summary of service delivery for the first 5 years of operation, including profit and loss statements, budget, statement of cash flows, financing plan, financial information for the main scenarios that govern the revenue model, bottom-up analysis of capital, and operating costs for telecom network operator services virtualization of the Internet of Things.
viii. The names of the departments and a profile of the persons authorized to handle and archive subscriber data.
 Submission of the technical plan to include the following:
  i. The proposed launch date for the services.
  ii. Description and design of any planned infrastructure, systems and operations, including the following details:
        a. Network operations.
       b. Customer care, after-sales services, and suggested service levels.
        c. Monitoring the performance of services, and the continuous development of the quality of services.
       d. Subscriber bills.
Service Description: Obtaining the permit after verifying the completeness of the documents and fulfilling the necessary conditions.

This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

License Name: Permit to Provide Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite Services
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue or cancel a permit for personal mobile communications services via satellite, which includes providing voice services, data/internet services, and emergency services within the Kingdom.
Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
• The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• Product specifications should match the Saudi, GCC  or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• Applicant shall abide by the conditions and regulations attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of commercial register and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by respective entities and Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of Articles of association for a limited liability company.
• Presence of the articles of association for a  joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or agencies if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuing an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years/year.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
License Name: Permit to Provide Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite Services
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue or cancel a permit for personal mobile communications services via satellite, which includes providing voice services, data/internet services, and emergency services within the Kingdom.
Conditions/Requirements:
•Applicant must be 18 years old or above.
•The employee must not be a governmental employee.
•The capital shall not be less than 5000 SAR.
•It is not required to issue a branch register for the same activity, practiced in the same administrative region.
Issuing the main register requires the following:
• Electronically submitting an application to establish the company.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Presence of a national ID.
Issuing a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
•Minimum capital of 500,000 SAR.
•Presence of the company's articles of association and articles of incorporation.
Issuing a branch register requires:
• Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, attested by the Chamber of Commerce.
• Confirmation of the investor's deposit at the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the investor's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
It is not required to issue a branch register in the event of a desire to practice the same activity, in the same administrative region, and under the same existing trade name.

This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Service Name: Issuance of a commercial activity license and safety certificate
Service Fees: Dpending on the classification + survey fees of 20 SAR
Conditions/Requirements:
Presence of a valid commercial register.
Presence of a permit from the Civil Defense, if there is an office.
Presence of the articles of association for companies.
Presence of the title deed or lease contract if there is an office.
Applicant shall not be prohibited from practicing the activity.
Applicant shall be committed to fulfilling the conditions of the activity.
Applicant shall be committed to updating the data in the system.
Applicant shall be able to request the issuance of a license for his shop on his own behalf or on behalf of another, with a copy of the Power of attorney.
Applicant shall ensure the validity and accuracy of the data entered, bearing in mind that all transactions through the beneficiary's account are binding.
The attached documents shall match the original copies.
Service Description: Fulfilling all the procedures, conditions and data required to conduct the  activity, and inspecting the site to to ensure it is licensed in accordance with safety conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.
This step is illustrative and not mandatory for the issuance of the permit.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology

License Description: This service enables the investor to issue or cancel a permit for personal mobile communications services via satellite, which includes providing voice services, data/internet services, and emergency services within the Kingdom.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
License Name: Permit to Provide Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite Services
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue or cancel a permit for personal mobile communications services via satellite, which includes providing voice services, data/internet services, and emergency services within the Kingdom.
Conditions/Requirements:
Presence of a valid commercial register, the validity period of which is not less than 3 months.
Presence of a valid general class license, the validity period of which is not less than 6 months.
Paying the fees for issuing the required permit.
Obtaining the approval of the relevant authorities in the event of cancellation of the permit.
Providing regulatory requirements for the service.
Submitting the application through the electronic licensing system.
Providing information about the entity, its representative, and an introductory profile of the applicant.
Providing a description of the services that will be provided in the Kingdom through this permit.
Providing technical specifications for the systems and devices that will be used in providing the service.
Providing service numbering requirements, if applicable.
Providing a proposed price plan for the provision of services.
Submitting all required documents and information in Arabic, and supporting documents (if any) may be submitted in English.
Submitting a copy of the legally binding agreement between the applicant and the operator of mobile personal communications systems and networks by satellite, to provide mobile personal communications services by satellite in the Kingdom, provided that it includes, as a minimum, the following:
  i. Names of the signatories according to the commercial register.
  ii. The duration of the agreement and its possibility of renewal.
  iii. Details of the roles and responsibilities of both parties.
  iv. The nature of the services provided.
Service Description: Obtaining the permit after verifying the completeness of the documents and fulfilling the necessary conditions.
Additional Information:
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
License Name: Infrastructure wholesale services license
License Description:
This service enables the investor to issue, renew, cancel, and add a category to the license for wholesale services for infrastructure, which enables him to establish, own, operate, and maintain elements of the communications infrastructure, and provide his services to other service providers who have individual licenses, or to any other entity exempted from the Commission. Infrastructure elements are determined according to the categories included in the scope of the license, which are as follows
Category A: towers and masts.
Category B: Small Cells, Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS), In-Building Solution Systems (IBS), Wireless Access Points.
Class C: dark fibers and culverts.
Category (D): Wholesale services for fixed data communication circuits, including connectivity services and active fixed access services.
Category (E): International cable capacity and landing station services.

Category (D): Wholesale services for fixed data communication circuits, including connectivity services and active fixed access services.
Category (E): International cable capacity and landing station services.
Conditions/Requirements:
Presence of a valid commercial registration, the validity period of which is not less than 3 months.
Providing regulatory requirements for the service.
Submitting the application through the electronic licensing system.
Providing a profile about the applicant.
 Submitting documents showing that (the applicant, the owner/s, the main shareholder/s, and the parent company) jointly own a total wealth exceeding (100,000,000) SAR for all categories except category “B”, as they must own a total wealth exceeding (1,000,000) (SAR.). Alternatively, submitting a letter of financial solvency from a Saudi bank or an international bank with approval from the Saudi Central Bank, confirming that the applicant will be entitled to sufficient financing to implement the work plan submitted to the Commission.
Providing details of the ownership structure.
Submitting an action plan for the first 5 years, which should include, at a minimum, the following:
  I. Infrastructure network deployment plans.
  II. The expected launch date of the services.
  III. A financial summary, which includes: (revenues, Capital and Operational costs, profit and loss statements, budget, statement of financial flows, financing plan, and capital structure). The presented financial information must include details of the main assumptions that govern the revenue model and bottom-up analysis of capital and operational costs
  IV. Operational plan and services, including: (services planned to be provided, products, services or targeted sectors, methodology for providing services, and any innovative services).
  V. The organizational structure, which includes: (senior management, organizational affairs, financial affairs, customer care service, specialized departments, operations, maintenance, and technical support).
  VI. The human resources plan, which includes: (the detailed plan for human resources, and the degree of compliance with the Saudization rates established in accordance with the Kingdom's laws, regulations, and legislation).
Submitting documents demonstrating relevant expertise and know-how, or trade agreements for telecommunications infrastructure and services.
Providing details of the infrastructure that is intended to be used in the Kingdom.
Providing technical specifications for the systems and devices to be used in providing the service.
Submitting a letter of acknowledgment of compliance that includes confirmation of compliance with paragraphs (1-5), (2-5) and (3-5) of the document licensing the provision of wholesale infrastructure services to the Commission.
Submitting all documents and information in Arabic, and supporting documents (if any) may be submitted in English.
 Paying the fees for issuing/renewing the required license.
 Obtaining the approval of the relevant authorities in the event of cancellation of the license.
Service Description: Obtaining the license after verifying the completeness of the documents and fulfilling the necessary conditions.
Additional Information:
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
License Name: Infrastructure wholesale services license
License Description:
This service enables the investor to issue, renew, cancel, and add a category to the license for wholesale services for infrastructure, which enables him to establish, own, operate, and maintain elements of the communications infrastructure, and provide his services to other service providers who have individual licenses, or to any other entity exempted from the Commission. Infrastructure elements are determined according to the categories included in the scope of the license, which are as follows
Category A: towers and masts.
Category B: Small Cells, Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS), In-Building Solution Systems (IBS), Wireless Access Points.
Class C: dark fibers and culverts.
Category (D): Wholesale services for fixed data communication circuits, including connectivity services and active fixed access services.
Category (E): International cable capacity and landing station services.

Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
•The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• The product specifications shall conform to the Saudi, Gulf or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• The license applicant shall abide by the conditions and requirements attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of the commercial registration and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by the competent entities and the Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of articles of association of a limited liability company.
• Presence of Articles of Association of the joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or entities if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years / year
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

License Name: Licensing a food facility in Modon in the absence of an existing building
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue a food facility license in Modon
Ministry Involved: Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones
Conditions/Requirements:
1- The factory must be licensed by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, the General Authority for Investment and free zones or the competent entities.
2- Food, drug and cosmetics factories must obtain license from the concerned entities, review and coordinate with the Saudi Food and Drug  Authority to ensure  quality of production and compliance with public health standards, and learn about health conditions in food factories and of their workers, and the requirements of pharmaceutical factories.
3- Factories with limited environmental impacts must obtain an initial assessment form, while factories with significant environmental impacts must revire  the General Authority of Meteorology and Environmental Protection when submitting an initial environmental assessment form to obtain a license, or submit a request to prepare an environmental impact study according to what the Authority deems appropriate.
4- Factories with serious environmental impacts, of which environmental pollution is feared, must obtain an environmental license from the General Authority of Meteorology and Environmental Protection or the competent bodies, after conducting an environmental impact assessment study by one of the consulting offices or research centers qualified by the General Authority for Meteorology and Protection. the environment.
5- The space required for the factory must conform with  the requirements of manufacturing and production.
6- The factory should have the minimum modern technologies in terms of  machines and manufacturing methodogies.
7- The factory site must be chosen carefully for it affects design and construction impacting effectiveness and productivity.
8- A suitable plot must be allocated in the industrial city for each industrial project after assessing it with the authority. The assessment takes into account future expansions that are justified through the presentation of a brief production planning study, giving an initial idea on the current demand and the assumed markets for disposal.
Service Description: Providing license issuance, modification and renewal services to enable facilities and empower individuals within the Economic cities and special zones to start real estate construction work.
Additional Information: This procedure is partially automated.

License Name: Licensing a food facility in Modon in the absence of an existing building
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue a food facility license in Modon
Conditions/Requirements:

Presence of an operating license from the Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones "MODON"  for factories within the industrial cities.

Compliance with the following standard specifications:
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 21 regarding health conditions in food factories and their employees (1984).
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 9 for packaged food labeling (2013).
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 168 for the requirements of stores for preserving dry and packaged foods (1994 AD).

Gulf Standard Specifications No. 21 regarding health conditions in food factories and their employees (1984 AD).
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 9 for packaged foodstuff labeling (2013 AD).
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 168 for the requirements of stores for preserving dry and packaged foodstuffs (1994 AD).

License Name: Licensing an industrial facility in the Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority in the absence of an existing building
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue a license for an industrial facility in the Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority.
Ministry Involved: Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority
Conditions/Requirements:
Presence of a valid commercial register, and the establishment contract of the facility, certified in his country by the competent entities and the Saudi embassy
A copy of the general manager's passport 
Presence of a copy of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality
Presence of a copy of the trade name reservation from the Ministry of Commerce
Presence of the articles of association for a limited liability company
Presence of the articles of association for a limited of the joint-stock company
Presence of the partners’ decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, explaining (the names of the partners, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility, the nature of the activity) 
Meeting the minimum capital for specialized activities carried out by mixed and foreign facilities                                                                                                              Completion of one of the following legal representation methods if a representative of the facility is appointed
- A Power of attorney approved by the competent entities.
An authorization approved by the Chamber of Commerce.
Obtainment of initial approval for some activities or licenses from other government entities, or what they represent them in the ECZA
Obtainment of site in Economic Cities in coordination with the main developer of the relevant city
Addition of decision-makers in the Chamber of Commerce signatures  for approval of post-incorporation decision
Ensuring the completion of government registrations and the validity of their documents and certificates (social insurance certificate, zakat or tax certificate, Saudization certificate, and the license of the General Investment Authority for a foreign facility, if any)
Appointment of a general manager determining his powers, certified by relevant entities and Saudi embassy
A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession
 Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan
Initial approval from relevant ministries or entities if required
Submission of a detailed business plan
Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy
The investor must have a good commercial reputation. He must not have previously committed any breach or crime
Applicant must comply with all laws and regulations in force in the Economic Cities in particular and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in general
The project should not be included in the list of excluded activities from foreign investment
Applicant shall not combine more than one activity in different sectors in one application, unless the activities branching from the main activity, and are in the same sector or complementary to the sub-activity of the facility
The activity to be invested in should be added to the Articles of association once the facility branches are launched, with the condition that the period of the parent facility establishment is minimum one year
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for an industrial facility for non-Saudis in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

License Name: Licensing an industrial facility in the Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority in the absence of an existing building
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue a license for an industrial facility in the Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority.
Conditions/Requirements:
• Applicant must be 18 and above
• The employee shall not be a government employee.
• The capital must be 5000 SAR and above.
• It is not required to issue a branch register if the activity is the same as the administrative region.
The issuance of a main register requires:
• Submitting an application to establish the company electronically.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Having a national identity.
The issuance of a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
 The capital must be 500,000 SAR and above
Submitting the company's articles of association.

The issuance of a branch Register requires:
Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, certified by the Chamber of Commerce.
Confirmation of the investor's deposit after the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the trader's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
It is not required to issue a branch register in the event of a desire to practice the same activity, in the same administrative region, and under the same existing trade name.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
•The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• The product specifications shall conform to the Saudi, Gulf or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• The license applicant shall abide by the conditions and requirements attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of the commercial registration and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by the competent entities and the Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of articles of association of a limited liability company.
• Presence of Articles of Association of the joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or entities if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years / year
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.

License Description: This service enables the investor to issue a license for a food facility on industrial plot within the municipal area.
Conditions/Requirements:
Presence a valid commercial register.

Presence of a copy of the power of attorney or authorization certified by the Chamber of Commerce for the delegated person.
Presence of a copy of the national identity, family registry, passport, or residence of the authorized person.

Issuance of a municipal license for factories located outside industrial cities.
Obtainment of an operating license from the Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones “MODON” for factories within industrial cities.
Issuance of a final industrial license.
Approval of the Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture on the water source and disposal of brine for bottled water and ice factories.
Implementation of the technical requirements specified in the Technical Requirements Guidelines.
Compliance with the following standard specifications:
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 21 regarding health conditions in food factories and their employees (1984 AD).
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 9 for packaged foodstuff labeling (2013 AD).
Gulf Standard Specifications No. 168 for the requirements of stores for preserving dry and packaged foodstuffs (1994 AD).

License Name: Licensing a food warehouse in the absence of an existing building within the scope of the Ministry of Municipal, Rural Affairs and Housing
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue a license for a warehouse that stores foods.
Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
•The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• The product specifications shall conform to the Saudi, Gulf or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• The license applicant shall abide by the conditions and requirements attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of the commercial registration and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by the competent entities and the Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of articles of association of a limited liability company.
• Presence of Articles of Association of the joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or entities if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years / year
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

License Name: Licensing a food warehouse in the absence of an existing building within the scope of the Ministry of Municipal, Rural Affairs and Housing
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue a license for a warehouse that stores foods.
Conditions/Requirements:
• Applicant must be 18 and above
• The employee shall not be a government employee.
• The capital must be 5000 SAR and above.
• It is not required to issue a branch register if the activity is the same as the administrative region.
The issuance of a main register requires:
• Submitting an application to establish the company electronically.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Having a national identity.
The issuance of a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
 The capital must be 500,000 SAR and above
Submitting the company's articles of association.

The issuance of a branch Register requires:
Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, certified by the Chamber of Commerce.
Confirmation of the investor's deposit after the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the trader's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
It is not required to issue a branch register in the event of a desire to practice the same activity, in the same administrative region, and under the same existing trade name.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

License Name: Licensing a facility for importing and distributing medical devices in the event that there is an existing building outside the scope of the industrial cities
License Description: This service enables the investor to import and distribute medical devices and supplies for the facility operating in this field.
Service Name: Issuance an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
•The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• The product specifications shall conform to the Saudi, Gulf or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• The license applicant shall abide by the conditions and requirements attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of the commercial registration and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by the competent entities and the Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of articles of association of a limited liability company.
• Presence of Articles of Association of the joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or entities if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years / year
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

License Name: Licensing a facility for importing and distributing medical devices in the event that there is an existing building outside the scope of the industrial cities
License Description: This service enables the investor to import and distribute medical devices and supplies for the facility operating in this field.
Conditions/Requirements:
• Applicant must be 18 or above
• The employee shall not be a government employee.
• The capital must be 5000 SAR and above.
•It is not required to issue a branch register for the same activity, practiced in the same administrative region.
Issuing the main register requires the following:
• Electronically submitting an application to establish the company.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Presence of a national ID.
Issuing a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
•Minimum capital of 500,000 SAR.
•Presence of the company's articles of association and articles of incorporation.
Issuing a branch register requires:
• Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, attested by the Chamber of Commerce.
• Confirmation of the investor's deposit at the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the trader's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
It is not required to issue a branch register in the event of a desire to practice the same activity, in the same administrative region, and under the same existing trade name.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Ministry Involved:
National Center for Environmental Compliance 

Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu
Conditions/Requirements:
Conditions and requirements to achieve National Center for Environmental Compliance:
Filling in the environmental classification form included in the list of environmental permits for the establishment and operation of activities.
Filling in a declaration form that there are no degraded or polluted sites for the activity.
Submitting an environmental rehabilitation plan prepared by a licensee from the National Center for Environmental Compliance.
Submitting waste disposal contracts from a licensed party.
Obtainig approval of the Permanent Committee for the Protection of the Coastal Regions Environment for projects that include backfilling or dredging works and are located within 400 meters of the shoreline.
Undertaking the implementation of results and recommendations of the environmental impact assessment study of the activities.

Conditions and requirements of the Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu:
Filling in environmental forms.
Submitting an environmental impact study.
Obtaining a land lease contract in the Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu.
Service Description: Granting a document to allow the commencement of construction work after completing the classification, assessment of the activity, and expected environmental impacts, as well as specifying the environmental conditions and requirements to be adhered to during the construction work.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources
License Name: Licensing an industrial facility within the zones regulated by the Ministry of Municipal, Rural Affairs and Housing in the event of the absence of an existing facility
License Description: Providing services for Issuance of, renewing, amending and canceling a license, or transferring its ownership to facilities that carry out manufacturing acivities.
Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
• The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• Product specifications should match the Saudi, GCC  or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• Applicant shall abide by the conditions and regulations attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of commercial register and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by respective entities and Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of Articles of association for a limited liability company.
• Presence of the articles of association for a  joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or agencies if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years/year.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources
License Name: Licensing an industrial facility within the zones regulated by the Ministry of Municipal, Rural Affairs and Housing in the event of the absence of an existing facility
License Description: Providing services for Issuance of, renewing, amending and canceling a license, or transferring its ownership to facilities that carry out manufacturing acivities.
Conditions/Requirements:
•Applicant must be 18 years old or above.
•The employee must not be a governmental employee.
•The capital shall not be less than 5000 SAR.
•It is not required to issue a branch register for the same activity, practiced in the same administrative region.
Issuing the main register requires the following:
• Electronically submitting an application to establish the company.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Presence of a national ID.
Issuing a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
•Minimum capital of 500,000 SAR.
•Presence of the company's articles of association and articles of incorporation.
Issuing a branch register requires:
• Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, attested by the Chamber of Commerce.
• Confirmation of the investor's deposit at the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the investor's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources
License Name: Licensing an industrial facility within the zones regulated by the Ministry of Municipal, Rural Affairs and Housing in the event of the absence of an existing facility
License Description: Providing services for Issuance of, renewing, amending and canceling a license, or transferring its ownership to facilities that carry out manufacturing acivities.
Service Fees:
First category: 1000 SAR
    Second category: 10,000 SAR
Third Category: Detailed in Additional Information
Service Duration:
First category: 15 days
    Second category: 40 days
    Third category: 85 days
Conditions/Requirements:
Filling in the environmental classification form included in the list of environmental permits for the establishment and operation of activities.
Filling in a declaration form that there are no degraded or polluted sites for the activity.
Submitting an environmental rehabilitation plan prepared by a licensee from the National Center for Environmental Compliance.
Submitting waste disposal contracts from a licensed party.
Obtaining the approval of the Permanent Committee for the Protection of the  Coastal Regions Environment for projects that include backfilling or dredging works and are located within 400 meters of the shoreline.
Undertaking the implementation of the results and recommendations of the environmental impact assessment study of the activities.
Service Description: Granting a document to allow the commencement of construction work after completing the classification, assessment of the activity, and expected environmental impacts, and specifying the environmental conditions and requirements to be adhered to during the construction work.
Additional Information:
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
 This procedure is partially automated.
  This procedure requires payment.
        The fee for reviewing the environmental classification form is 500 riyals.
        The fee for the third category depending on the construction cost:
13,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost is 10 million.
            27,500 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 10 and 25 million.
            45,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 25 and 50 million.
            75,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 50 and 100 million.
            137,500 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 100 and 250 million.
            275,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost exceeds 250 million.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources
License Name: Licensing an industrial facility in the sites supervised by the Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu in the event of the absence of an existing building for primary and secondary industries
License Description: Providing services for Issuance of, renewing, amending and canceling a license, or transferring its ownership to facilities that carry out manufacturing activities.
Ministry Involved:
General Authority for Military Industries
SFDA
Conditions/Requirements:
•Presenting a valid commercial register specifying the commercial activities licensed by the Authority.
Complying with the regulations governing the practice of military industries activities, and all relevant laws and regulations in the Kingdom.
Registering in the military licensing platform, and filling in the data of each of (the applicant – the CEO – the authorized person), adding all controlling persons, and ensuring that the information and details are correct.
• Completing security and safety requirements for the issuance of a military license (for incorporation permits).
Providing the Authority with any update on the information as soon as it occurs.
Clarifying the names of the products that shall be manufactured.
Filling in the initial information about the scope of research and development, if there is a field (research and development).
Filling in the actual information for manufacturing and products in detail.
Updating the data of the authorized person and the controlling persons in case of change.
Submitting a security and safety certificate/letter from the High Commission for Industrial Security.
Submitting a site license from the host or permission from the military entity if the factory is inside military areas. 
Submitting social insurance record.
The (foreign) applicant must have a legal presence in the Kingdom in one of the following legal forms: (sole proprietorship - limited liability company - joint stock company).
One of the founders (controlling persons) shall not have been previously sentenced to penalty or an offence prejudicial to hounor or inyegrity or a disciplinary decision has been issued against him dismissing him from military service, unless he has been rehabilitated.
Service Description: Submitting a request to obtain a manufacturing license depending on the activity.
Additional Information:
This procedure is automated.
This step is activated if the activity is licensed by the General Authority for Military Industries or the SFDA

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources
License Name: Licensing an industrial facility in the areas of the Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu in the event of the absence of an existing building for light and support industries
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue, renew, amend and cancel a license, or transfer his ownership of facilities that carry out manufacturing activities.
Service Name: Issuance of an investment license for the foreign investor
Conditions/Requirements:
• The investment activity shall not be included in the list of activities excluded from foreign investment.
• Product specifications should match the Saudi, GCC  or international specifications.
• Applicant shall not have conclusive rulings against him due to violations of system provisions inside or outside the Kingdom.
• Applicant shall abide by the conditions and regulations attached to the investment license application form.
• Investment objectives shall be achieved and conditions and regulations on license renewal applications shall be implemented. 
• Presence of a license to practice commercial activity in the Kingdom for foreign investors.
• Presence of commercial register and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by respective entities and Saudi embassy.
• A commercial register or an extract from the civil status as a proof of profession.
• Presence of Articles of association for a limited liability company.
• Presence of the articles of association for a  joint-stock company.
• Presence of the general manager's passport.
• Presence of the national ID and the family card if one of the partners has the Saudi nationality.
• Submission of the partners' decision stating their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the partners' names, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of its activity.
• Appointment of a general manager, determining his powers and certifying it by respective entities and the Saudi embassy.
• Provision of initial approval from the relevant ministries or agencies if the activity requires approval.
• Provision of a detailed action plan.
• Submission of a minimum of 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, showing the soundness of the financial position. The budget must be approved by an accounting office and certified by the concerned body and the Kingdom’s embassy.
• Proof of financial capability to invest, commensurate with the project's capital and each partner's share, in line with the submitted business plan.
• Reservation of a trade name with the Ministry of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for non-Saudis to practice commercial activities in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
A value of 10,000 SAR will be added to the subscription to the services of the Investor Relations Centers at the Ministry of Investment in the first year, and 60,000 SAR in the following years/year.
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources

License Description: This service enables the investor to issue, renew, amend and cancel a license, or transfer his ownership of facilities that carry out manufacturing activities.
Conditions/Requirements:
•Applicant must be 18 years old or above.
•The employee must not be a governmental employee.
•The capital shall not be less than 5000 SAR.
•It is not required to issue a branch register for the same activity, practiced in the same administrative region.
Issuing the main register requires the following:
• Electronically submitting an application to establish the company.
• Submitting a letter signed by the founders establishing the company.
• Presence of a national ID.
Issuing a main register for joint-stock companies requires:
•Minimum capital of 500,000 SAR.
•Presence of the company's articles of association and articles of incorporation.
Issuing a branch register requires:
• Submitting a letter from the company stating the issuance of a company branch, including the city of the branch and the branch manager, attested by the Chamber of Commerce.
• Confirmation of the investor's deposit at the end of the company's fiscal year.
Service Description: A legal document that contains the investor's data and his activity, enabling him to carry out his activity with an official permit in accordance with the specific conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

Licensing Entity Name: Ministry of Industry and Mineral Resources
License Name: Licensing an industrial facility in the event of the absence of an existing building in the Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority
License Description: This service enables the investor to issue, renew, amend and cancel the license. It also enable him to provide services for the purpose of establishing facilities of all kinds within the economic cities and special zones and start practicing the activity.
Ministry Involved: Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority
Conditions/Requirements:
Presence of a commercial register and articles of association of the facility in its country, certified by the competent authorities and the Saudi embassy.
Presence of a reserved trade name.
Presence of articles of association for the limited liability company and the joint stock company.
Submission of the partners' decision, which indicates their desire to invest in the Kingdom, indicating the names of the partners, the capital, the ownership percentage of each partner, the main office of the facility and the nature of the activity.
Submission of a copy of the passport of the general manager.
Provision of a copy of the national ID and family card, if one of the partners is a Saudi citizen.
Submission of an extract from the civil status.
Provision of an initial approval from the relevant ministries or entities if the activity requires approval.
Provision of a detailed action plan.
Submission of a minimum 3 year budget for the facility requesting a license from outside the Kingdom, approved by an accounting office and certified by the relevant body and the Kingdom’s embassy, to show the soundness of the financial position.
The investor should have a good commercial reputation, and he should not have been previously convicted of any violation or crime.
Applicant must comply with all laws and regulations in force in Economic Cities in particular and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in general.
The activity to be invested in should be added to the Articles of Association when branches of the facility are opened , provided that the period of establishing the parent facility is not less than one year.
The project should not be included in the list of excluded activities from foreign investment.
An activity within different sectors must be added in one application, with the exception of activities that are subsidiary to the main activity, and are in the same sector or are complementary to the sub-activity of the facility.
The signatures of the decision makers in the Chamber of Commerce should be added for  approval of the post-incorporation decision.
Applicant must ensure the completion of government registrations and the validity of their documents and certificates (social insurance certificate, zakat or tax certificate, Saudization certificate, and the license of the Ministry of Investment for a foreign facility, if any).
For some activities, initial approval or licenses must be obtained from other government entities, or from where they are represented in the Economic Cities Authority.
To obtain a site in the Economic City in coordination with the main developer of the concerned city.
Appoint a general manager and determine his authority, and have it certified by relevant authorities and the Saudi embassy.
The financial ability to invest must be demonstrated in proportion to the capital of the project and the share of each partner, in accordance with the action plan submitted.
The minimum capital must be met for specialized activities carried out by mixed and foreign establishments.
One of the following legal representation methods shall be met in case a facility representative is appointed:
A Power of attorney approved by relevant authorities.
An authorization approved by the Chamber of Commerce.
Service Description: Issuance of an investment license for an industrial facility for non-Saudis in accordance with the specified conditions and requirements.
Additional Information:
This procedure requires creating a new account if it does not exist.
This procedure is automated.
This procedure requires payment.

13,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost is 10 million.
27,500 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 10 and 25 million.
45,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 25 and 50 million.
 75,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 50 and 100 million.
 137,500 SAR for projects whose construction cost ranges between 100 and 250 million.
275,000 SAR for projects whose construction cost exceeds 250 million.
